bill_title: revise certain provisions related to the transfer of certain alcoholic beverage licenses.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions related to the transfer of certain alcoholic beverage licenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 35-4-13 be amended to read as follows: 35-4-13. If by reason of the annexation of territory by any municipal corporation or county, the premises of an on-sale licensee shall be are transferred from one jurisdiction to another, such the licensee shall continue to legally operate until the expiration of such license. Thereafter, such the licensee shall make application for his license renewal apply for renewal of the license to the governing board which has jurisdiction of the licensed premises, and such the license shall may not be denied on the grounds that, by the issuance of such the license, more on-sale licenses are in existence than is permitted by the limitations of this chapter. However, a license transferred from one jurisdiction to another by annexation may not be transferred to a new location pursuant to § 35-2-7 for a period of three years following the date of annexation. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
